Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2014 03:53PM Midnite91 wrote: Hi I am a 7 month survivor.  My journey begins 2 years ago when I went in for mamogram and heard the same as you.  Every 6 months for two years I went in for 1) mamogram  2) repeat mamogram  3) Ultrasound  4) Biopsy.  Do not worry about the biopsy they are painless but a very necessary part of the journey.  Finally one day after another biopsy I talked to my primary care provider about getting a bilateral mastectomy, I was tired of the poking and prodding and with my family history she agreed as well as the oncologist and plastic surgeon.  In January 2014 I under went a bilateral mastectomy and 1 week later when I returned to the plastic surgeon for a post surgical check up he told my husband and I that my left breast was 50% consumed with cancer cells that were just starting to become invasive.  The moral here is that mamograms are not a total answer but by doing everything that you should be doing you have a very good chance of catching it early.  I have had three surgeries since January and am very healthy and cancer free.  Please have the biopsy, continue to do self exams, get your mamograms as recommended and pay attention to your body....no one knows you as well as you do. To be honest I had this feeling down deep inside that something was not right. Good luck my friend, you are in my prayers.
